issue.title: [CF 515] "* ignore GCD" mailfunction
issue.body:
"Bars ignore GCD" and "Cooldown ignore GCD" options doesn't seem to be working.
These options should exclude GCD from "Usable" flag in my opinion.
Version: r529


> Posted by CurseForge user d9d9 | Imported from CurseForge issue #515 | Raw

comments.body:
This is the way TellMeWhen has always worked (icons ignore the GCD when determining if they are usable or unusable) and is not likely to ever change unless you can thoroughly convince me otherwise.

Apologies for such a late response to your ticket.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Maybe we are not on the same page. Let's clarify: if icons do ignore GCD like you said then they should NOT disappear on GCD. Right? But they actually DO.

Simple test: create warrior, create "Spell Cooldown" for "Battle Shout" with "Usable" option checked. Go to dummy and hit "Mortal Strike". "Battle Shout" icon will disappear and appear again in 1.5sec.

That's doesn't makes sense. While GCD is active you have 1.5 sec to choose next spell to use. But how can you choose spell if it is hidden by GCD's "not available" ?

That's in MoP. Maybe it works fine on live.

Edited Aug 12, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user d9d9

Well, that certainly would be a bug, then. Does this only happen for warriors?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I've looked into this. The bug occures irregardless of whether icons or bars ignore the GCD. What's happening is that every icon for an ability that consumes or generates rage goes invisible during the GCD. Turning up the alpha when failed makes them faintly visible again. Warrior abilities that don't interact with the ragebar function normally.

Edited Aug 14, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer

Fixed in r533. Apologies again for discrediting you and your report initially.

Edited Aug 15, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Note that the cause of the issue was that the warrior GCD spell was set to Rend, which apparently has been removed from the game. You can tell I don't play a warrior, can't you?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Yes, rend has been removed and yes issue seems to be fixed in r533. Thanks!


> Posted by CurseForge user d9d9
